text:
"[...] This will let the class-level CSS kick in if nothing was set by the content creator, otherwise the content creator can specifically set margins themselves without trouble." <-- This is good. Give control to content editors if they want to change the default spacing while the CSS allows for "automation".

I was not aware of the full-width embed option. Was this recently implemented? However, we have removed all !important now and it works for us. It is a minor thing that articles before 2019-09 will not have the same width as newer articles, which was the reason why we added !important. Because we wanted the layout to be consistent regardless. Also, we were afraid you would change things again :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey <@UA5DFM7CK>, you have to add a bunch of the form fields module within a custom module. There is a Follow-up Email field type. Here is an example of a form using all the possible fields

```
{% form
			form_key="{{name}}",
			form_to_use="{{module.form.form.form_id}}"
			title="{{module.form.title}}"
			no_title="{{no_title}}"
			follow_up_type_simple="{{module.form.follow_up_type_simple}}"
			simple_email_for_live_id="{{module.form.simple_email_for_live_id}}"
			follow_up_type_automation="{{module.form.follow_up_type_automation}}"
			form_follow_ups_workflow_id="{{module.form.form_follow_ups_workflow_id}}"
			response_response_type="{{module.form.form.response_type}}"
			response_redirect_id="{{module.form.form.redirect_id}}"
			response_redirect_url="{{module.form.form.redirect_url}}"
			response_message="{{module.form.form.message}}"
			notifications_are_overridden="{{module.form.notifications_are_overridden}}"
			notifications_override_email_addresses="{{module.form.notifications_override_email_addresses}}"
			gotowebinar_webinar_key="{{module.form.form.gotowebinar_webinar_key}}"
		%}
```
anybody else experience the CMS and FTP being slow for the last couple days?
the design manager, yes. it would take 15 seconds sometimes to save a minor code change over the last day or two.
Hi! :slightly_smiling_face: Does anyone know whether automatic image resizing for page speed works on a page that is still unpublished and in preview mode?
I'm referring to this -- <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/can-i-disable-automatic-image-resizing>
YES!!! <@U22VBL87M>
cc <@UBFA10FMF>
what <@U22PKFRU5> said!!

The “full-width” embed option was paired with the embed updates to the HTML structure/new classnames that have been rolling our recently. We are in the midst of releasing a prod notify for the new embed features/structure. You happened to find this out before we released the notification (we should have released this prior to you stumbling over it, however).

The plan is for this new embed structure & classnames to not change! The embeds are in a better state with the new updates, and if we can give control to the content editors to specify inline styles for margins as mentioned then things will be looking pretty solid.

> we have removed all !important now and it works for us

Really glad to hear this! I will reach out to you once we’ve figured out a solution to the above^ when you can remove the `!important` from your class margin styles, but in the meantime it looks like you are in good shape :smile:

<@UATE4ATHP> Thanks so much for helping me out with this, man. Really appreciate it.  Where I’m getting stuck is allowing control via the CMS to select the follow up email.  Or is that just automatically generated when I add in the Hubl?
<@UA5DFM7CK> there is a follow up email selector
<@UATE4ATHP> Ahhhh, now I see what might be up. The customer account I’m in doesn’t have that field type.  Is this something that needs to be turned ON that you’re aware of?
<@UA5DFM7CK> pretty sure they need to have Marketing Hub Professional and Enterprise
<@UATE4ATHP> dude, thanks so much for the assist. That makes sense.  I thought I was going crazy.
No prob. Glad I could help
Hi all! Does anyone know of a definitive guide to AdWords conversion tracking on HubSpot? All roads seem to lead to using thank you pages, in the end, but is the only option?
Hi guys, what is Hubl tag to retrieve all tag names from the blog?
you would want the `{{ blog_tags() }}` function: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-tags>
Jumping on this bandwagon too, my whole team has been experiencing it. Help us <@UBFA10FMF>i-wan Kenobi, you're our only hope.
<https://slackhq.com/dark-mode-for-slack-desktop>
it’s beautiful btw

We're looking into this, but I'm having trouble reproducing from my end. Anyone notice any trends? Do you have lots of templates open? Is it after working on something for a certain amount of time? Does running `localStorage.clear()` help?
I'm afraid to count how many tabs I have open tbh.....
seems to be fine at the moment
My life today
closed the gazillion tabs I had opened. Seems to be fine now :slightly_smiling_face:
Yes!!! Loving dark mode!
design manager is slower than normal but were i'm noticing it most is FTP is taking a long time to connect
Hi, anyone know if I can make a filter with ajax of post or pages on HubSpot, I have of version Enterprise
We deployed out a fix around ~2:30pm EST today that should fix the performance issues present the last few days
